cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 37.2 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 1st ranked rain rate was registered today with a peak rate of 16.6mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  5.69mm of rain fell during the storm's 3.2 hours length.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rain rate of 27.0mm per hour, lasting 15.0 hours and totalling rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: On 04 January 2025, rainfall persisted for 37.2 hours, accumulating 36.8mm at falling at 4.6mm per hour at times.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (193°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.6 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.5°C) and outside temperature (down 3.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 10193 lux), pressure (down 7 mbar), cloud levels (up 200 m), and rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13518 lux), cloud levels (up 1668 m), and rainfall (down 0.7 mm) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 200.5m lower than yesterday, 559.5m lower than the past week, 1668.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 565m and a high of 1838m, averaging 910.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. Periods of rain anticipated, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and dim or diffuse light conditions. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
